intro: Rudgea laevis, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its smooth, velvety leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. It is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Rudgea laevis is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage.
